issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Update: Note the typo in the word 'nama' != 'name' in the xml. Correcting this typo still shows/discovers more node than given in the xml config, but now they are in disabled state. 

Opening this ticket to discuss the behavior of the discover flag, and possibly it's default value when using euca-configure-vmware. 
It appears that the broker is picking up nodes that are outside the list of hosts provided when the discover flag is set to 'false' . 
This could be due to the flag being set to 'true' at some point prior to this test and this may be related to EUCA-8216?
Thanks,
-M

{code}
[root@c-08 ~]# euca-describe-properties PARTI00.vmwarebroker.configxml
PROPERTY	PARTI00.vmwarebroker.configxml	<!-- Eucalyptus VMware Broker configuration file -->

<configuration>
	<vsphere>
		<endpoint url="https://10.111.1.133/sdk" login="euca-test" password="XXXXX" discover="false">
		<host nama="10.111.5.76" login="root" password="XXXXX" />
		<host name="10.111.5.59" login="root" password="XXXXX" />
		</endpoint>
	</vsphere>
</configuration>
[root@c-08 ~]# euca-configure-vmware -E
Network mode: SYSTEM
discovered 11 host(s)
	10.111.5.59 login=root datastoreName=datastore1 (4) uploadViaHost=null network=VM Network
	10.111.5.135 login=root datastoreName=datastore1 (2) uploadViaHost=null network=VM Network
	10.111.5.100 login=root datastoreName=datastore1 (5) uploadViaHost=null network=VM Network

	10.111.5.129 login=root datastoreName=datastore1 (8) uploadViaHost=null network=VM Network
	10.111.5.76 login=root datastoreName=datastore1 (3) uploadViaHost=null network=VM Network
	10.111.5.148 login=root datastoreName=datastore1 (7) uploadViaHost=null network=VM Network
	10.111.5.95 login=root datastoreName=datastore1 uploadViaHost=null network=VM Network
	...

</configuration>
[root@c-08 ~]# euca-describe-nodes

comments.body: [~mclark], could you re-test this with the new Broker?

I tested this yesterday, didn't see this issue. Worked for me.
